intro: Erigeron annuus, commonly known as the common fleabane, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features a basal rosette of leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disk, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Erigeron annuus is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
